qas.question: What is the defiition of the part of short-term memory known as episodic?

What type of short-term memory allows people to recall specific events?

context: While short-term memory encodes information <a0_0>acoustically<a0_0/>, long-term memory encodes it <a1_0>semantically<a1_0/>: Baddeley (<b5_0>1966<b5_0/>) discovered that, after 20 minutes, test subjects had the most difficulty <a4_0>recalling <b6_0>a collection of words that had similar meanings<b6_0/><a4_0/> (e.g. big, large, great, huge) long-term. Another part of long-term memory is <a3_0>episodic <b8_0>memory<b8_0/>,<a3_0/> <a2_0>"<b7_0>which attempts to capture information such as 'what', 'when' and 'where<b7_0/>'<a2_0/>". With <b9_0>episodic memory<b9_0/>, individuals are able to recall specific events such as birthday parties and weddings.
